metadata.title: CVE-2021-4041 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in ansible-runner. An improper escaping of the shellcommand, while calling the ansible_runner.interface.run_command, can leadto parameters getting executed as host's shell command. A developer couldunintentionally write code that gets executed in the host rather than thevirtual environment.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4041` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-ansible-runner - 2.1.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible-runner package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
